mvp.listener

Interface ListenerView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListenerDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListenerDialog, AbstractListenerView

    public interface ListenerView
extends java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This interface provides a basic API to allow for a GUI class to pass events to ActionListeners outside of the class. This design is meant to facilitate loose coupling between view and controller components of a program, allowing them to interact through the ActionListener interface without needing direct knowledge of each other.

    In addition to providing methods to add and remove external ActionListeners, this interface extends the ActionListener interface itself. This allows implementing classes to simply assign this as the listener for all actionable components, easily funneling all events to an external listener without the components needing any knowledge of the listener's existence.

    Lastly, the getValueForAction(String) method is provided as a tool to allow the external listeners to perform the proper action. Many times, the action that needs to be done will require a value inputed by the user. This method provides an abstract way to acquire the necessary value(s) based on the actionCommand parameter passed to the method. NOTE: This works best when action command values are set as constants.

    NOTE: All views implementing this interface should be added to the appropriate controller prior to the GUI being displayed.

    THREAD SAFETY: Swing is NOT thread safe. Since this interface is intended to be used with Swing classes, its methods should only be accessed on the EventDispatchThread.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    AbstractListenerController, AbstractPropertyModel

      void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
      Adds an ActionListener to the list of listeners in this view.
      java.lang.Object getValueForAction(java.lang.String actionCommand)

      • Methods inherited from interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

        actionPerformed

    • Method Detail

      • getValueForAction

        java.lang.Object getValueForAction(java.lang.String actionCommand)
        Returns a value from the view that is needed to perform a given action. The actionCommand parameter passed here determines which, if any, value will be returned. If no value is needed for a particular action, simply return null.

        THREAD SAFETY: Again, this is a Swing class. Controllers that off-load their tasks to other threads need to make sure that they only call on this method on the EventDispatchThread.

        Parameters:
        actionCommand - the action command for the action being performed, to determine which, if any, values are needed from this view.
        Returns:
        the value needed for the specified action, or null if no value is needed.

      • addActionListener

        void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Adds an ActionListener to the list of listeners in this view. The listener being passed to the view should function as a controller for implementing business logic in response to user-triggered ActionEvents in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener being added to this view.

      • removeActionListener

        void removeActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Removes an ActionListener to the list of listeners in this view.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener being removed from this view.
